pageContext.claim: “According to a recent study, student progress in math decreased by half and -- using online education compared to in-person or campus education.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is referring to a study from researchers at Harvard and Brown that examined a single online math program. Researchers found that through late March student math progress declined by roughly half among low income students — not all students. The same analysis found that it rebounded by the end of September, when total student progress was down just 3.3 percent and progress among low income students was down just 2.9 percent.
